title: Playful Valentine proposal page for Palak with shrinking No button and celebratory Yes message

requirements.text: Create a single-page Valentine proposal UI that asks Palak to be the user's Valentine, with two prominent buttons labeled "Yes" and "No".

quotes: i want a website where i ask the person named palak to be my valentine and there are two options yes and no

acceptanceCriteria: The page displays a clear prompt addressed to "Palak" asking her to be the user's Valentine.
All user-facing text is in English.

requirements.text: Implement the "No" button interaction: each time "No" is clicked, the "No" button progressively shrinks until it becomes extremely small, making it difficult to click compared to "Yes".

quotes: whenever she clicks on no the button gets smaller to a point where she has to click yes

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking "No" reduces the button size on each click (e.g., scaling down step-by-step).
The "No" button continues shrinking on repeated clicks and never grows as a result of clicking "No".
The page remains usable (no layout-breaking overflow or jitter) as the "No" button shrinks.

requirements.text: Implement the "Yes" button interaction: when "Yes" is clicked, replace the prompt/buttons (or clearly transition the UI) to show a large celebratory message: "YAYYYY I LOVEEEEEEE YOUUUUUUUU".

quotes: when the yes is clicked show a big text "YAYYYY I LOVEEEEEEE YOUUUUUUUU"

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking "Yes" displays the exact text: "YAYYYY I LOVEEEEEEE YOUUUUUUUU" (matching capitalization and spelling).
The message is visually large and clearly the primary content on the screen.
After clicking "Yes", the user can no longer trigger the shrinking "No" behavior (buttons are hidden/disabled or the view has transitioned).

requirements.text: Apply a coherent, playful Valentine-themed visual design (colors, typography, spacing, and layout) consistently across the page without using a blue/purple primary palette.
acceptanceCriteria: The page uses a consistent Valentine aesthetic (e.g., warm reds/pinks/creams, romantic typography choices, soft shadows).
The design is responsive and looks good on both mobile and desktop.
Primary styling does not use blue/purple as the dominant theme colors.

requirements.text: Add the required generated images into the app as static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated and use them in the Valentine page layout.
acceptanceCriteria: The specified image files exist under frontend/public/assets/generated.
The page visually incorporates the generated images (e.g., as a background/decoration) without fetching them from the backend.

constraints: Frontend immutable paths must not be edited: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui.
Do not add additional backend services; keep the app frontend-only unless explicitly required.
Use English for all user-facing text.
nonGoals: User accounts, Internet Identity login, or any authentication flow.
Sending messages, emails, notifications, or any real-time communication.

required: Seamless cute heart pattern background, soft warm palette (valentine-bg.dim_1920x1080.png)
Single large hand-drawn heart doodle with subtle shading, transparent background (heart-doodle.dim_512x512.png)
